author: ghudson
msg: More libsvn_fs_fs design notes.
* README: Add some notes about problems, one easy and one hard.

author: ghudson
msg: Refine the libsvn_fs_fs rev file format a little.
* libsvn_fs_fs/structure: It's not practical to encode the length of
a text rep at the beginning of the rep itself, because don't know
how much svndiff data we're going to write until we've written it.
So put that information in the references to the text reps instead.
Also, when props and text reps are unmodified, we should just put
in a pointer to the old representations instead of making new ones.
So we need a rev in the "rep" and "props" field.

author: ghudson
msg: Revert r9272; I vetoed it a half-day or so after checkin in
http://subversion.tigris.org/servlets/ReadMsg?list=dev&msgNo=62431
for correctness reasons ("make all" should include the test programs;
if it doesn't, make flags don't apply to the test builds, and also
"make check" output is polluted with build commands).
A convenience target could be added to build everything except the
tests, of course.

author: ghudson
msg: Fix a bug in the marshalling of errors with no messages.  Since we
can't easily change the message to be optional, marshal NULL
messages as "".
* libsvn_ra_svn/marshal.c:
(svn_ra_svn_write_cmd_failure): Marshal NULL messages as "".
(svn_ra_svn_read_cmd_response): Unmarshal "" messages to NULL.

author: kfogel
msg: Allow the db/ subdir of a repository to be a symlink.  Subversion
works just fine this way, so there's no reason to error.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/repos.c
(check_repos_path): Use svn_io_check_resolved_path to check db dir.
